thread.title: Jefferson County school board president Ken Witt seeks ethics opinion on himself
thread.title_full: Jefferson County school board president Ken Witt seeks ethics opinion on himself - The Denver Post

author: Jesse Paul
title: Jefferson County school board president Ken Witt seeks ethics opinion on himself
text:
LAKEWOOD â€” Ken Witt, board president of Jeffco Public Schools, announced at a news conference Thursday that he has filed a request for an advisory opinion from the Colorado Independent Ethics Commission.
He said he has asked commission to investigate whether he was involved in breaking any open meetings laws.
Witt, a conservative member of the board, said his move was in response to a recall effort seeking his ouster.
"I'm just calling their bluff," Witt said Thursday.
He reiterated that he does not believe he violated open meeting laws.
"These are baseless accusations and I want to shed light on reality," Witt he said.
The school board recall will be held during the general election on Nov. 3 .
With the recall to oust the three board members halfway through their four-year term, while the two other members are choosing not to seek re-election, voters could select an entirely new board when they start receiving ballots.
A group called Jeffco United for Action put the recall on the ballot, targeting the three conservative school board members: Witt, Julie Williams and John Newkirk. The group has cited disagreements with the board majority going back to weeks after their election in 2013.
